questions.question: What is the integral form of Maxwell's fourth equation (Ampere's law with Maxwell's addition) in a differential medium?

How does the Larmor formula describe the power radiated by an accelerating non-relativistic point charge?
options: Proportional to the square of the charge and inversely proportional to the cube of the acceleration
Proportional to the square of the charge and the acceleration
Proportional to the square of the charge and the square of the acceleration
Proportional to the charge and the square of the acceleration
questions.correct_answer: Proportional to the square of the charge and the square of the acceleration

A surface that is not symmetric with the charge distribution it encloses
questions.correct_answer: A surface that is not symmetric with the charge distribution it encloses

The speed of a photon as a function of its wavelength
